column1: '''In Western Lands''' is a song that was sung by [[Sam Gamgee]] on [[14 March]] {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}</ref> in the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]].  Sam had just climbed to the top of the stairs in the tower but could not find [[Frodo Baggins]]; he felt he was not actually at top of the tower but he was unable to discover any way that led upwards. Defeated
column4: he began to sing.  At first he only recited childish tunes and rhymes
column5: but then a new song arose in him:

column1: In western lands beneath the Sun
the flowers may rise in Spring
Though here at journey's end I lie
beyond all towers strong and high
above all shadows rides the Sun
I will not say the Day is done

Sam began to sing the line "Beyond all towers strong and high" again but stopped abruptly when he thought he could hear a faint answering voice.  The voice stopped but then he heard the footsteps of [[Snaga (orc of Mordor)|Snaga]] approaching.  Sam's voice
column4: who came to shut Frodo up.  Snaga brought in a ladder which enabled him to reach the final chamber above
column5: soon to be followed by Sam.<ref>{{RK|VI1}}</ref>

column1: Donald Swann wrote music for this song
column2: which can be found in the book ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road Goes Ever On]]'';<ref>{{RGEO|Lands}}</ref> it is also found on the accompanying CD of the latest version.
